p: PAMPS are constitutive components of the virus and bacteria (viral or bacterial nucleic acids, polysaccharides, Lipopolysaccharides, Lipid A, monophosphoryl lipid A, bacterial peptidoglycans, etc.). They are compounds universally recognized by the innate immune system of healthy subjects, who build a natural protective response against them. In contrast, modern purified, fractionated, recombinant, or synthetic vaccines gained in safety but lost potency because they lack the PAMPS ( Table 1). While, vaccines using inactivated organisms with PAMPS have shown great success against polio, whooping cough, and tetanus ( 17, 18).
